Context: SCP entry, banter between members of a specialized task force about to explore a building that suddenly appeared with anomalous topography, filled with various hostile entities and cognitohazards
AP-3 Ross: "...Use your broadcasters if nobody is responding, and shoot anything that moves. (Pauses) Unless itâ€™s one of us, probably."
AP-3 Noah: "Then definitely shoot."
(Team laughs)
oook
What, not a fan of deprecating humor?
Huh... apparently I have an interest in voice acting, but not a professional interest, haha
I got a 65% in Theory of Everything 2
I was doing my take on an anomalous clown held in a cell inside an anomalous Site from an alternate universe c:
SCP is fun :ptv-hearts:
I like SCP
SCP-1730 is fascinating
It's Site-13 from an alternate universe.  One where at least one Site Director is less than ethical.  To be honest, calling him an a-hole would be too kind.
in all stories, you have to have someone to hate
Not necessarily :P
SCP doesn't often have things to actively hate :P
Most of the time, it's just stuff with anomalous properties.  One of the cooler ones I can think of is a red fox that's made entirely of super-heated plasma
That's basically it.  It behaves like a normal fox.  It just happens to be very destructive due to the nature of its form xD
There was another one I read, I can't remember the number, where we're actually the bad guys
An alternate universe (one presumably without the foundation and the fun little threat of SCPs) is like us almost entirely.  The languages are different, but they're human.
The difference is that they are scientifically far more advanced than us in fields such as mathematics and physics, but woefully behind in fields like chemistry and biology.

They created a wormhole that connected our universes and we start communicating, eventually there's a slowdown in communication because their planet is currently experiencing a pandemic.  Not a very threatening one, but definitely enough to muck things up
Oh the coincidental timing of me reading this entry! Haha.
Turns out that it's nothing more than a variation of the Flu.  So the SCP scientists create a vaccine and send it back through.  It's proven effective and is provided to the entirety of their planet.
But it came with a HUGE downside.  It dropped fertility rates to extinction-causing levels.  At one point they had only 1000 live births across the entire planet for a single day.
So, we, trying to be helpful (and arrogant for thinking it would be so easy) doomed an entire planet.  And so they vow revenge on us.

In a technical sense, they are a fruit
But for economic / trade reasons they're listed as a vegetable due to how they're used.
Iirc, this was actually a court case a LONG time ago.
Oh shiz
Nix v. Hedden (1893)
It was a legitimate Supreme Court case that dictated tomatoes be considered a vegetable by customs
Anyways...
They're tomatoes
That launch themselves at you when you make an attempt at humor :D
The results of which can range from nothing more than what you'd expect from a heckler to [REDACTED]
so theyâ€™re sentient bad comedian bombs
no angry audience required to be thrown at a bad joke
What's extra funny is during a test session, they showed a tomato a comedy skit from SNL.  It was based around Hillary Clinton, but I can't remember what specifically it was about.
In short, the tomato proceeded to accelerate, stop, and reverse course in no particular order multiple times throughout the skit at very high velocity
Seemingly unable to determine if it was "funny" or not.
